ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Between 5 and 12 years old - Failed to give close attention to details or made careless mistakes in my work or other activities
Between 5 and 12 years old - Had difficulty sustaining my attention in tasks or fun activities
Between 5 and 12 years old - Didn't listen when spoken to directly
Between 5 and 12 years old - Didn't follow through on instructions and failed to finish work or chores
Between 5 and 12 years old - Had difficulty organizing tasks and activities
Between 5 and 12 years old - Avoided, disliked, or was reluctant to engage in tasks that required sustained mental effort
Between 5 and 12 years old - Lost things necessary for tasks or activities
Between 5 and 12 years old - Was easily distracted by extraneous stimuli or irrelevant thoughts
Between 5 and 12 years old - Was forgetful in daily activities
Between 5 and 12 years old - Fidgeted with my hands or feet or squirmed in my seat
Between 5 and 12 years old - Left my seat in classrooms or in other situations in which remaining seated was expected
Between 5 and 12 years old - Shifted around excessively or felt restless or hemmed in
Between 5 and 12 years old - Had difficulty engaging in leisure activities quietly (felt uncomfortable, or was loud or noisy)
Between 5 and 12 years old - Was on the go or acted as if driven by a motor
Between 5 and 12 years old - Talked excessively
Between 5 and 12 years old - Blurted out answers before questions had been completed, completed others' sentences, or jumped the gun
Between 5 and 12 years old - Had difficulty awaiting my turn
Between 5 and 12 years old - Interrupted or intruded on others (butted into conversations or activities without permission or took over what others were doing)
